subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Another son of the former Canadiens great Patrick Roy is facing disciplinary action for his on-ice behavior. Frédérick Roy was suspended 15 games by the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League for high-sticking during the Quebec Remparts’ game against the Montreal Juniors on Friday. During a timeout, Roy, a forward, struck Montreal defenseman Vincent Bourgeois in the mouth.
